node.title: 'Self-isolation won't be something that we ask people to do forever' - Hipkins
node.description: There could be significant rates of Covid-19 in the community once overseas New Zealanders can self-isolate at the end of the month, Covid-19 Response Minister Chris Hipkins says. Audio

node.title: Person dies after dirt bike crash in Southland
node.description: A person has died after a dirt bike crashed at Bald Hill in Southland.

node.title: Peng Shuai meets with IOC president
node.description: Peng also denied to a French newspaper that she ever accused a Chinese official of sexual assault, calling it an "enormous misunderstanding."

node.title: U.S. overnight coverage includes events in snowboarding, skiing and luge.
node.description: The men’s downhill event gets going after being postponed by high winds.

node.title: Covid numbers remain low inside Beijing’s ‘closed loop.’
node.description: Arrivals are tested at the airport and then isolate in hotel rooms until the results come back a few hours later.

node.title: Fiji's PM needs 'time to recuperate', govt says
node.description: The Fijian government says Prime Minister Frank Bainimarama needs "time to recuperate" after undergoing heart surgery in Australia.

node.title: Covid-19: Waikato high schools contact families after students test positive
node.description: Both Hamilton Christian School and Rototuna Junior High in Waikato are dealing with Covid-19 outbreaks.

node.title: The deep unfairness of New Zealand public holidays
node.description: If you work weekdays you're probably enjoying a day off today - and if you are working, you're likely getting time and a half. But a surprisingly large section of our workforce doesn't get either…

node.title: What are those blue lines on the snow?
node.description: By Lauren McCarthy

node.title: HHS secretary to take more active public role in coming weeks
node.description: Xavier Becerra appears to have taken a backseat to people like Dr. Fauci and COVID response czar Jeffrey Zients despite outranking them.

node.title: 21-gun salute to be held in Wellington to mark Queen's jubilee
node.description: A 21-gun salute will be in Wellington to mark the 70th anniversary of the Queen's accession to the throne. Audio

node.title: Germany’s ‘Invisible’ Chancellor Heads to Washington Amid Fierce Criticism
node.description: Olaf Scholz will try to repair Germany’s credibility in the Ukraine crisis when he meets President Biden on Monday. Next on his agenda: Kyiv and Moscow.

node.title: Domino's expanding drone delivery service
node.description: Pizza chain Domino's says its delivery driver roles are not in danger as it prepares to extend its drone delivery trial.

node.title: Ottawa declares state of emergency over COVID protests
node.description: Residents are furious at the nonstop blaring of horns, traffic disruption and harassment, fearing no end is in sight after the police chief called it a "siege" that he could not manage.

node.title: Solomon Islanders warned worse to come as Covid-19 cases soar
node.description: The Solomon Islands prime minister Manasseh Sogavare made a national address yesterday saying there are now 2790 cases in the country.

node.title: Prince Charles leads Jubilee tributes to 'remarkable' Queen
node.description: He welcomed his mother's wish that Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall, be known as Queen Consort when he becomes King.

node.title: Investigating vehicle training deaths in the military
node.description: Lesley Stahl speaks with parents of service members killed in training and reports on why so many vehicle training accidents occur in the U.S. armed forces.

node.title: The residential schools behind Canada's unmarked graves
node.description: Last year, archeologists detected what they believed to be 200 unmarked graves at a residential school in Canada, bringing new attention to one of the country's most shameful chapters.

node.title: Staff shortages, COVID patients pushing hospitals to breaking point
node.description: Sharyn Alfonsi reports from Louisville, Kentucky, as shorthanded hospitals are having their limits tested by the pandemic.

node.title: Bad weather closes North Island roads with more heavy rain forecast
node.description: A number of North Island roads are closed as a result of bad weather with MetService forecasting heavy rain for the top and east coast of the island.

node.title: Gun fired on Auckland street after fight at city bar
node.description: Police say they received a report of a disorder on commercial premises on New North Road, Kingsland about 9.30pm yesterday.

node.title: Omicron's 1pm overhaul? Top expert suggests new way of tackling case numbers
node.description: New Covid infections yesterday plunged from Saturday's record tally but one epidemiologist believes the daily case numbers may not reflect the true extent of community spread.

node.title: State of emergency declared over Canadian truck blockade
node.description: Ottawa Mayor Jim Watson has declared a state of emergency to help deal with an unprecedented 10-day occupation by protesting truckers that has shut down much of the core of the Canadian capital.

node.title: Australian PM signals reopening borders to tourists 'not far away'
node.description: Scott Morrison says parliament will debate the matter this week.

node.title: Russian attack on Ukraine possible 'any day now', White House says
node.description: The US says Russia has prepared '70 per cent' of military might to launch an attack on Ukraine, but that a peaceful solution to the tensions is not out of the question.

node.title: 'Changing climate': Homes lost as hundreds of firefighters battle spate of destructive blazes in Western Australia
node.description: Authorities say changing climate conditions are a factor in the increased intensity of fires as crews battle dangerous and destructive blazes.

node.title: Three people with serious injuries after Rotorua assaults
node.description: A number of people in Rotorua were assaulted in the early hours of Sunday morning, police say.

node.title: 18 people rescued from ice floe in Lake Erie
node.description: The Coast Guard rescued 11 people, while a "Good Samaritan" who had an airboat rescued the remaining seven, the Coast Guard said.

node.title: Indian singing legend Lata Mangeshkar dies at 92
node.description: The celebrated singer had been admitted to hospital after testing positive for Covid-19.

node.title: Recycling startup growing, despite tornado and pandemic
node.description: A plastic recycling business brought to its knees by a tornado is back on its feet, promising to transform the industry - if it can find the right investors.
